column1: Inza (Russian: И́нза) is a town and the administrative center of Inzensky District in Ulyanovsk Oblast
column3: located on the Syuksyumka River (Sura's basin) 167 kilometers (104 mi) southwest of Ulyanovsk
column4: the administrative center of the oblast. Population: 18

column1: It was founded in 1897 as a settlement around a railway station. Urban-type settlement status was granted to it in 1938; town status was granted in 1946.
Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Inza serves as the administrative center of Inzensky District. As an administrative division
column5: incorporated within Inzensky District as the town of district significance of Inza. As a municipal division
column6: the town of district significance of Inza is incorporated within Inzensky Municipal District as Inzenskoye Urban Settlement.
